channel.title: Wakatime on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Wakatime on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: All watched over by machines
item.description: As it turns out, a detailed look at the way you spend time over the course of a day online yields several fascinating conclusions. As previously noted, Wakatime is the introspective tool of choice. Gee, that’s a lot of time to look at Facebook, Twitter, and Gmail; Why aren’t you spending more of your productive time writing; I’ll bet that if you put down the computer your day would be more productive.

item.title: wakatime, an automatic time tracker for programmers
item.description: Wakatime tracks your time if you’re a programmer. It does this by integrating into your favorite text editor (including vim) and your favorite source code maintainence system (including Github) and then matching time spent editing with checkins into your system. It collects stats behind the scenes and turns everything into a shiny dashboard. “Fitbit for programmers” is the tag line. That which is measured, improves. I don’t know if wakatime will improve your writing, or your coding, or your general state of mind.
